{{Use mdy dates|date=March 2014}} {{Infobox person | name = Deon Cole | image = Deon Cole 2016.png | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1972|1|9}} | birth_place = [[Chicago]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = | other_names = | education = [[Thornridge High School]] | alma_mater = [[Philander Smith College]] | occupation = Actor and Comedian | years_active = 1998–present | known_for = ''[[Black-ish]]''
''[[Angie Tribeca]]''
''[[Grown-ish]]'' | children = 1 }} '''Deon Cole''' (born January 9, 1972) is an American actor, comedian, and comedy writer. Originally based out of Chicago, he is best known as a member of the writing staff of ''[[The Tonight Show with Conan O'Brien]]'' (2009–2010) and subsequently ''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'' (2010–present) and also for being a cast member on ''[[Angie Tribeca]]'' (2016–present). Cole had a recurring role on the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] sitcom ''[[Black-ish]]'' as Charlie Telphy which was changed to main role from season 4 onwards. He has appeared frequently in comedic bits for both broadcasts and has, along with the rest of the staff, received two [[Primetime Emmy]] nominations. He first got into comedy when a friend bet him $50 that he would not get up on stage one night in Chicago.{{cite web|url=http://splitsider.com/2013/06/talking-to-deon-cole-about-stand-up-conan-and-his-new-tbs-show-black-box/|title=Talking to Deon Cole About Standup, ‘Conan,’ and His New TBS Show ‘Black Box’|first=Blair|last=Socci|date=June 13, 2013|work=Split Sider|publisher=The Awl|accessdate=July 4, 2017}} Cole has also performed stand up on other programs such as ''[[John Oliver's New York Stand-Up Show]]'', ''[[Mash Up (TV series)|Mash Up]]'' and ''[[Lopez Tonight]]''. Cole created his own production company, Coled Blooded, to produce the sketch comedy show ''[[Deon Cole's Black Box]]''. It premiered on June 10, 2013 on [[TBS (U.S. TV channel)|TBS]] but was canceled on October 25, 2013. Cole has hosted the game show ''Face Value'' on [[BET]] since 2017. ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title !
